qas.question: What is the philosophy of dualism?
Who was the leader in pushing the philosophy of Visistadvaita?
For the existence of what did the Visistadvaita philosophy argue?
What being did Ramanuja believe was the personification of Brahman

plausible_answers.text: Brahman as an impersonal empty oneness

qas.question: What did Visistadvaitins and Advaitins agree on?
What was the philosophy of qualified dualism?
Who did Advaitins believe was a personification of Brahman?

context: <a1_0><b5_0>Ramanuja<b5_0/><a1_0/> (<a2_0>c. <b6_0>1037<b6_0/>–1137<a2_0/>) was the foremost proponent of the philosophy of <a0_0><b8_0>Viśiṣṭādvaita<b8_0/><a0_0/> or qualified non-dualism. Viśiṣṭādvaita advocated the concept of a <a3_0>Supreme Being<a3_0/> with essential qualities or attributes. Viśiṣṭādvaitins argued against the Advaitin conception of <b7_0>Brahman as an impersonal empty oneness<b7_0/>. They saw Brahman as an eternal oneness, but also as the source of all creation, which was omnipresent and actively involved in existence. To them the sense of subject-object perception was illusory and a sign of ignorance. However, the individual's sense of self was not a complete illusion since it was derived from the universal beingness that is Brahman. Ramanuja saw <a4_0><b9_0>Vishnu<b9_0/><a4_0/> as a personification of Brahman.
